2 Factories

Egeo provides a series of AngularJS factories to work together with the components and helpers.

2.1 ChildrenClass

@providertested

The ChildrenClass Provider adds a CSS class to the child elements of the first child node of the directive.

Usage

This a sample directive from the Toolbar component where you can see how to use the EgeoChildrenClass Provider. ´´´ (function() { 'use strict';

angular
    .module('egeo.toolbar', [])
    .directive('egeoCToolbar', egeoCToolbar);

egeoCToolbar.$inject = ['EgeoConfig', 'EgeoChildrenClass'];

function egeoCToolbar(EgeoConfig, EgeoChildrenClass) {
    var directive = {
        ...
        link: EgeoChildrenClass('egeo-c-toolbar__item'),
        ...
    }

    return directive;
}

})(); ´´´

And now you can see the code of the template. Note that the main html node allow transcluded content.

<div class="egeo-c-toolbar" data-ng-class="{'egeo-u-float--right': atRight}" data-ng-transclude></div>

The idea is that all nodes included as transcluded content, will receive automatically the egeo-c-toolbar__item class. So the final code should be something like that.

<div class="egeo-c-toolbar" data-ng-class="{'egeo-u-float--right': atRight}">
     <div class="egeo-c-toolbar__item">Sample 1</div>
     <div class="egeo-c-toolbar__item">Sample 2</div>
     <div class="egeo-c-toolbar__item">Sample 3</div>
</div>
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest
